meanings.definition: Work hard over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: She was slogging through her homework all night.
meanings.sent2: The team slogged through the tough training session.
meanings.sent3: He slogged away at his project until it was finally finished.
meanings.sent4: The workers slogged through the heavy rain to finish the construction on time.
meanings.sent5: The determined hiker slogged up the steep mountain trail.

meanings.definition: Walk or move with difficulty or effort.
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker was slogging through the muddy path.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers slogged through the swamp during their training.
meanings.sent3: The kids slogged through the thick snow on their way to school.
meanings.sent4: The old car slogged up the steep hill slowly.
meanings.sent5: She slogged along the beach, collecting seashells.

meanings.sent1: He slogged the ball out of the park with a powerful swing.
meanings.sent2: The boxer slogged his opponent with a series of quick punches.
meanings.sent3: The player slogged the ball into the outfield, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: She slogged the hammer down onto the nail, missing it completely.
meanings.sent5: The chef slogged the garlic with the back of the knife to crush it.
